text:
If excess CO2 from human activity is causing global warming, how did an ice sheet 3 1/2 miles thick on top of North America melt before the Industrial Revolution ?   
All of you alarmist are being misguided by fear as all of you deniers are guided by the preservation of profit.  
      Basic biology, animals adapt to the environment, not the other way around.  Do you really think the entire cosmos was supposed to stop spinning and the earth is to remain temperate for our comfort? .... 
Try typing in google 
"Geological eras" and click images. 
and before you come at me with your narrative driven dogma... type in google 
"Glacial interglacial transition abruptly"
read... and stop believing science.  That is an oxymoron, science doesn't require belief to exist, it requires data.
     Summer is coming, adapt....  

Imagine how freaked out humanity will be when the next ice age comes around...smh

We all know that forest is the key to fight climate change.We should make a law around the world that every human must plant a tree every year it should be made mandatory.Ik it's not easy to convince every country to do this but most populated countries like usa, india and others would definitely be willing to do it. We have 7 billion people around the and imagine atleast 4billion people planting trees every year.  Just like how we have details in identity card, we should add number of trees planted in their lifetime to their identity card. And number of trees planted must also benefit people with some freebies and rewards which motivates people to plant more. There should be competition held between countries in number of trees planted every year. Just like sports. 

2. Switch all vehicles to electrical and make mandatory rules that every house should be powered by solar energy if they can afford to buy.

text: Climate change happens. The climate change doomsday is in question because of the falsified data that was used to push climate hysteria all in the name of funding.  If climate doomsday was real we would be a desert planet, in an ice age, or mostly under water two times over. Instead of saying hey maybe we shouldn't be freaking out about it they just pushed back the date. Nobody believes climate doesn't change but the billion dollar a year industry is motivated by greed funding and grants not with saving the doomed planet.  The world was said to have been flat and it took one scientist to say no its round and if by the same logic used on climate doomsday that scientist would get labelled  a science denying heretic.

author: Freethink

text: We would definitely agree not every issue should be solely viewed through a public health lens! That said, increasing heat stroke, asthma, and stroke are definitely public health concerns, and while governments are also trying to address climate change, it's not solely a political issue - it's just a fact. It's also worth noting that these doctors are focusing on their own industry and what they can do to make it more environmentally friendly, rather than waiting for politicians. One of the drawbacks of the current political climate is it can cause us to see everything as a political issue, and draw battle lines when we don't need to.
author: Freethink

text: ¬†@Freethink¬† Public Health is at war against free humans! Down with it all!

author: Pepe the Frog

text:
We agree it needs to be an international effort! It's a global problem which needs global solutions, and agreements need to be reached to prevent companies from 'exporting' their emissions to less-regulated countries. In this video, doctors from India, Australia, and Britain are featured for their efforts to reduce environmental pollution and emissions in their countries from health care, an industry which is difficult to transfer abroad. 

In terms of the United States, it's a mixed picture. It receives special attention both for its role in global leadership and because it has emitted far more than any other country: https://ourworldindata.org/contributed-most-global-co2 . On the other hand, it has pioneered leading environmental reforms like eliminating lead from gasoline and CFCs that destroyed the ozone layer that have helped reduce pollution at home and around the world. Many countries around the world now have environmental restrictions, though enforcing them can be a key challenge. There's more details on the current picture of regulations and pollution internationally available at https://www.hbs.edu/faculty/Publication%20Files/GCR_20012002_Environment_5d282a24-bb10-4a9a-88bd-6ee05e8c6678.pdf .

One way or another, we all need to work together to solve this, so the more cooperation and less finger pointing all around we have, the better off we will be!
author: Freethink

text: We are glad you are already familiar with the movement of doctors working to reduce emissions in the health care industry! We suspect many people are not, so we want to spread their inspiring story and example to those who aren't.
author: Freethink
